intro: Malouetia albiflora, commonly known as the white-flowered malouetia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and clusters of small, white, fragrant flowers. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Malouetia albiflora is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
